meanings.definition: A period of fifteen years, used in dating documents.
meanings.sent1: The historian referred to the indiction as a way to mark time.
meanings.sent2: The indiction on the ancient scroll indicated the year it was written.
meanings.sent3: During the indiction, people would gather to celebrate the passing of time.
meanings.sent4: The indiction stood as a silent witness to the events of history.
meanings.sent5: In the indiction, memories of the past were preserved for future generations.

meanings.definition: A proclamation or decree issued by a Roman emperor.
meanings.sent1: The indiction from the emperor was read aloud to the citizens.
meanings.sent2: Citizens eagerly awaited the next indiction to know the emperor's will.
meanings.sent3: The indiction brought both excitement and apprehension to the people.
meanings.sent4: The indiction echoed through the city, shaping the lives of all.
meanings.sent5: In the indiction, the emperor's words carried the weight of law.
